name: Messari
title: Richard DeVaul (Co-founder, XNet ) | Fully Diluted with Messari Research | Unqualified Opinions
text:
Synopsis
XNet is pioneering a decentralized wireless network that provides mobile data offloading services by leveraging existing Wi-Fi infrastructure, creating a more cost-effective and efficient alternative to traditional mobile carriers through blockchain-enabled infrastructure.

Key Insights
- XNet operates as a neutral host mobile network operator, enabling over 150 million mobile phone users to automatically connect to their network
- The company generates revenue by getting paid by mobile operators for data offloading, with a unique tokenomics model that involves 80% buy and burn of revenue
- Currently serves millions of users and has direct deals with major US mobile network operators
- Migrated from Polygon to Solana blockchain in August, citing better support, tools, and community
- Addresses critical mobile network challenges like coverage and capacity limitations, especially in urban areas
- Uses existing Wi-Fi 6 and enterprise-grade Wi-Fi infrastructure, reducing deployment costs
- Rewards radio operators with tokens based on data transmission, creating a decentralized incentive model
- Aims to expand internationally, with discussions ongoing with non-US mobile network operators
- Roadmap includes developing better management tools, creating a network validation app, and expanding site acquisition programs
- Long-term vision involves creating a peer-to-peer communications network that reduces reliance on centralized telecom infrastructure
